  • Incident Date: 2025-07-08
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN

  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location a wooden crate containing a 2.2 was dropped. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that the gauge on the release valve was at zero. It is believed that the drop damaged the valve causing a release of the contents. The shipment was placed into the DG cage at the location and the shipper will be contacted for disposition of the package.

item.description:
Report E-2025070360

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: NEW CARLISLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 2, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN267 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green for Life Environmental (GFL) to remediate the site. The damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews utilized hand tools, absorbent pads and neutralizing agents to collect all residual product into one additional (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2025070228
item.description:
Report E-2025070228

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to unknown reasons that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 35-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the damaged containers. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

In the box there were 7 plastic containers (Siemens, Advia 120, Advia 2120, Advia 2120i, CBC TIMEPAC) . 2 RBC PLT @ 2700 ml, 2 HGB @ 1100 ml, 2 BASO @ 1100 ml and 1 Defoamer non regulated chemical @ 75 ml. The corner on one of the 2700 ml containers was dented with a small pin hole. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 25, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Hydrochloric Acid was forked and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Response Management Services (RMS) to remediate the site. RMS personnel deployed an acid neutralizer mix and worked in with hand tools. All Hydrochloric Acid-20 Baume-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for transport and disposal, and the punctured drum was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for further transport.

  • City: INDIANAPOLIS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A declared dangerous goods shipment of UN1814, Potassium Hydroxide Solution, Packing Group III was involved in a forklift incident during sort operations at the Federal Express hub in Indianapolis, IN. The outer fiberboard packaging contained two intermediate fiberboard boxes containing two 2L plastic inner containers each. After damaging both the outer and one of the intermediate packagings, one of the plastic inner containers was punctured by the forklift, spilling its entire contents. The product spilled was from Roche Diagnostics, product name “CleanCell M” (part #: 04880293190). The outer box did have proper dangerous goods markings and labeling, and an accurate Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum for containment and is being held pending further disposition instruction.

  • Description: At 0155 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at BIN. It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 released from a 355-gallon metal tote due to the seal at the top of the tote being damaged (see photos). The release impacted tote/concrete. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a Scheduled contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-ounce of UN1993 Unisol Liquid Rd BK-50 product released to a 4’ x 4’ area impacting the top and sides of the metal tote due to broken gasket/improper packaging. A new gasket was requested with the shipper which was received and replaced. The contractors performed the slosh test and cleaned the outside of the tote.
